number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 2, 2014
												Based on my experiences of playing this game for about 20hrs (the Steam timestamps are somewhat screwed up here) I'd like to warn fellow sympathisers of Ragnarok Online who are rushing into its successor with high expectations:I expected Ragnarok 2 to have something to do with the original Ragnarok Online. I installed the game full of anticipation it would be a Ragnarok Online in 3D ! With a beautiful and diversive world to explore ! With new skills and a better fighting system ! I'll be able to make a completely individual char, a wholly black knight and♥♥♥♥♥♥like that ! This will be awesome !After starting the game I figured that I would be disappointed in even my lowest expectations.- The gameplay is a simple WoW copy and utmost boring. Why would you limit the fights to auto-attack rounds in a game like this? Let me fight myself.- The "open world" is more of a path you follow - from village to village - doing your repetitive 'kill 20 of these', 'get 10 of those' quests. Always the same type of quests with no emotionally involving content behind. Couldn't they think of anything to evoke the player's passion about playing this game?- Using the exact same job class system as in its predecessor I was very surprised to see that Monks now can't use the Acolyte skills they acquired before. I am sure there are similar rip-offs with other job classes. I am not against inventions, improvements and new stuff but there is nothing positive about this.- Everything is very colourful and cute but the game fails to surround me with spectacular, astonishing or inspiring environments - Ragnarok Online does that even in 2D.- I don't know why but I had difficulties crafting items, using items, buying items, trading items, ... maybe it's just me but it felt very complicated and not as conveniently accessible as it should be.- Almost all usable items are timed, which makes you lose interest in getting or using those in the first place.- Do you remember the feeling that you got in Payon Dungeon? Orc Dungeon? When entering Prontera? The Geffen fields? The Comodo Beach? You won't get even close here...- "Ragnarök" is an event in the old Germanic and Viking mythology. The meaning behind all terrains, quests, names and monsters in Ragnarok Online is a combination of different culture's mythologies (i.e. Munak and Bongun referring to Chinese Jiangshi, you also find Korean, Taiwanese and other references).Now in Ragnarok 2 I am told to obtain the crown of the Sunflower King. wtf?I wished it was a Ragnarok Online turned into 3D graphics, with an active fighting system, some cool character individualizing stuff and maybe even some open world building elements (I'd love to build my own in-game house with my own obedient Kafra servant) but what we got is all annoying stuff about WoW put together in pretentious Anime style, claiming to be the successor of Ragnarok Online. I am sorry but I couldn't think of anything positive to say about this game. I guess the in-game music is not as disturbing as it possibly could've been. A few musical references to its predecessor would have been nice, though.

content:
Posted: October 27, 2014
												Not as much depth as the original as far as the class system goes, but that doesn't necessarily leave much to be desired. To the contrary this simplifies (maybe oversimplifies) things in a managable way. I'm currently playing each of the the classes except Archer and each one is enjoyable. They're fun to play and each feels unique without feeling too much like the same classes from other MMOs. In short, it stands out and not just because of its heritage. However, its still mostly dependent on the cliches and tried and true formula of the genre, so if you're simply too jaded to try another MMO then stay away from this one, but I will tell you that its entertaining in its own right.Disclaimer: I didn't play the original, so I can't speak of the story-telling, quest-system, or over-arching game systems/structure. This is just my general opinion of a generally great MMO.

content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
												Never played the first Ragnarok but I've played the phone version of the first one. And i can honestly say that I really like the graphics/game play of the first one (if the phone one is anything close to the actual first Ragnarok). Ragnarok Online 2 is a game that I personally enjoyed and from the first night of playing it me and my friend got to lvl 10. Now being the huge MMORPG fan that I am and like any MMO, Ragnarok 2 has some faults that any MMO will have. One of the biggest faults of RO2 is the grind between levels and the amount of exp that some quests will give you. In the early levels of RO2 you don't really realize the grind since it's not hard to level up a new character from.. lets say 1-10, then 10-15 and then 15-20. The leveling system is all good until you get to lvl 20 and then try and get to lvl 25 so that u can learn your claases new job (mine being thief going to rogue). With knowing that you can learn a new job soon and get some new moves, you get all pumped and go the hardest you can to lvl quickly. This is where you quickly notice the change in the exp rate and how much exp you need to actually lvl.....This is where the grinding starts to really get annoying. If Gravity fixed the leveling system past level 20, it would make the game a whole lot more fun and make it feel less than a chore. Over all I would recommend this game since it has bought me and countless friends that I have already recommended this game to hours of fun! My advice for this game is to make sure that you have a friend with you when you get to lvl 20, so you don't have to get bored out of your mind when trying to lvl!

content:
Posted: May 14, 2013
												Before playing this game throw all your notions of the original out the window, this game is nothing like that. RO2 is more of a 'WoW Clone' instead of being a 'true' sequel in terms of gameplay and structure. That being said, it is not a bad game especially for being completely free. Fans of the original should keep an openmind should they wish to check it out. If you're a fan of standard MMOs then this is not a bad option. Visuals are decent but some spell effects look somewhat lazy, character models are good and the musi is alright but there are some odd quips. Overall 3.5/5, its free so you got nothing to lose in trying it out.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2015
												Overall: It's a great game if you have a connection to RO1 & want some time away from the serious games. Not so great if you want to feel you accomplished something. RO1 was the epitome of grind/reward.I played RO1 from closed beta to at Niflheim, and was in some of the very serious guilds. It's fun to see how the old was integrated, but it's VERY different. The world & monsters are AMAZING, but I get a bit annoyed with all the "run there, talk to XXX" quests. The quests are rarely confusing but most are too easy (laughable vs RO1 quests). Another annoyance is the incredibly low inventory space they give you.I experienced zero bugs and video performance was outstanding. I was blown away how big they made some of the maps & some of the intricate details. The character/NPC models & movements always make me smile. I'm not exactly sold on the music (still better than Lutie s***), but the SFX are good.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
												Ragnarok Online 2 is pretty controversial among Ragnarok fans, I find most dont like it. That being said I myself dont dislike the game, even if it does have a good deal of pay to win features. I feel like it might have actually been better off if it had not used the Ragnarok IP, it probably would not have gotten so much hate if it just did its own thing. I find most of the hate really is just because the Ragnarok name got "dragged through the mud" so to speak. Now, that being said I feel like if you are not familiar with old Ragnarok, you might find Ragnarok Online 2 much more enjoyable, especially if you dont mind grind or pay to win in your anime styled MMO. I have really mixed feelings about RO2 but I know some people do enjoy it. its definitely not the worst MMO on Steam.

I still have quite a bit to learn.... so... this is mostly just my opinion on mmorpg's... and not the game itself... as my laptop (the dell inspiron N5010) isn't really meant for gaming and i get a lot of lag whenever i record or play games. Now.... I'm not gonna post any spoilers.... but... i haven't gotten too far into the game... i've only completed a few story quests and side quests... and.... currently still trying to earn enough money to create a guild... I give this game.... 1000000/10... will definitely play over and over again...

content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												I have 2 high lvl characters, monk and Wiz, and I find nothing wrong with the game thus far. Its fairly easy to lvl up and have a good time with friends. I'll call it a casual MMO, since the game can be too easy and it really doesn't fire up my competitive nature. The game does have its share of bugs but nothing game breaking. The english needs a bit of work. The story is there and intact, if a bit generic. I say this as an MMO veteran, Its no WoW, SWTOR, and GW2 but its enjoyable all the same. If you are new to MMO gaming, this game is not for you, as I have had to figure out a lot of things on my own - no hold my hand tutorials. All in all I give it a 7/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												This game (even with the reboot) was quite a disappointment to the expectations on what a Ragnarok Online sequel should be like. They tremendously simplified the game, removed many monsters, classes and characteristic features from the original. They also over-modernised the stat system and character progression. When I tried the game (2013), the graphics were unpolished - shadows were very pixellated and the tree foliage often obstructed the camera.Can't really think of any good sides, they removed all that made the original Ragnarok Online and replaced it with a generic modern MMORPG. Pity.(Actually there were some concepts that I liked more in the pre-rebooted version - it was very different from the original RO, but at least it had its own distinct flavour. This new one is just bland :/ )

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 13, 2013
												An amazing experience.Classes are your basic for any MMORPG but do a much better job than other games at handling themCombos really flow well.Jobs are amazing. Farming is not hard but not easy. All jobs such as cooking provide you with different benefits, feel free to go what you want. The game has wonderful graphics, amazing for a free to play game.People may give this 0/10 for not living up as a sequel, but that is not it's job, I am reviewing this game, not how well it did compared to it's predecessor.Overall, this game has amazing music, basic to moderate story, great graphics, wonderfully polished classes and professions, bosses, player interactions.

Posted: February 26, 2014
												Very indepth game. Graphics are some of the best that I have seen. Story line flows nicely. For those who love to free roam, this is for you. Being able to work on a class and a job is exciting. You can choose to further one or the other or both. For those who like to Role Play, creating your character and playing with fellow role players this world is expansive. You can immerce yourself into this game and get lost in it. The character itself moves wonderfully. Being an old RO player myself, I was judgemental to start with, but now, I love this game just as much as I did RO.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2014
												I was an enormous fan of the original Ragnarok Online. I find II to be fun, but perhaps too much like its obvious successor, WoW, to be worth playing for long periods of time. The graphics and its eternal cuteness is a nice, refreshing change, though. And as a 'Free For Play', you can't go wrong with the price. For my own personal taste, I give it a definite pass. However, for someone who wants a taste of WoW, with a charmingly cheerful atmosphere and no cost to goof off, Ragnarok Online II is not your worst choice!

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2013
												I've never been one for MMORPG's. I've tried a couple but none of them seem to pull me in very far and I get bored and leave in the first couple hours. But this game is one amazing exception. The artstyle and look of the game is beautiful, so colourful and detailed. The voice acting is really good as each character and NPC has a voice rather than just a silent protagonist. Gameplay is as you would imagine it to be with an MMORPG with you levelling up and buying new skills with your points. This game has some nice additions, my favourite being the 'Card' system. When you kill and enemy there is a chance he will drop a card, this card then can be equipped and add special bonus stats to you character. That one thing alone makes me want to go out and fight as many monsters as I can and believe me there are many, all of which looks beautiful and unique. The story is well crafted and I've managed to stay with it with no confusion at all. For a free to play, you should definately get it and play with friends. It get's a lot better when you create a party and devise your strategies together which become incredibly effective.10/10

content:
Posted: May 5, 2013
												All fans of original Ragnarok Online will find many nostalgic moments in this game: familiar monsters who still look awesome even in 3D, characters with very well known names (like Eremes Guile) or nice gags like Green Zeppelin band of Rockers who will ask you to bring their lost instruments and who sing about some girl buying a stairway to Valhalla. Unfortunately, it's a bad MMO in everything else. It's nice to dive deep in the world of Rune Midgard again, but it's really disappointing that RO2 does not deliver what you would expect from ressurrection of legendary MMO. I would recommend this game only to hardcore fans of original Ragnarok. At least to see what it's like now.

number of helpful: 9 of 21 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
												First things first guys. If you want a game with no bugs, or P2W, then pay a monthly fee. As you can see I like this game for many reasons, but I will be unbias in my review. Let's prove it by talking about the downfalls:The three worse parts about RO2 are the leveling and the [lack of] PvP, and the release of new content. In my thousands of hours of WoW, it is fair to say, that a much better Quest line system from lvl 1 to max level is available in other games. The leveling is very, very grind-till-you-drop style. There are three kinds of Quests: 1. Kill this monster twenty times (some times for an item it drops to give to the quest giving npc) 2. Talk to this npc  3. Gather this item. Poor planning of Patch release dates that bring new content to the game. There have been three, no wait, four new dungeons in six months added to the game. I have the best gear in the game (^^) but to be honest, a lot of people are either skipping new raid dungeons to go to the newest one, or moving to the most recent raid dungeons half geared from the one before it (my point is a "new" dungeon shouldn't become redundant after a month an a half). They would be better off releasing 4-8 dungeons a year all at once, or six months at a time, and letting players work through them tier by tier.Pvp is entirely under developed, but they did add a new PvP map, which is actually pretty awesome, if you have a DPS cahracter. Healers are not really needed unless they are a hybrid (DPS mixed with Support). There are three maps: 1. Colo (it is a big open circle so not really a map) on this map you free for all with 30 other players for 5 rounds and people are eliminated each round 2. WOE (don't even get me started) this is a poorly designed map with too many choke points and you can only enter with your guild (fyi: I am in a very large, strong guild) and the big, strong guilds always win (my guild is PVE based) 3. Jehoon Training Site (nice map and game play) uses a lane and tower mechanic like DOTA or LoL with merchants to buy buff scrolls and monsters in the "jungle" which you kill for a quest to obtain items and points to win the match or buff your team (also debuffs other team).PVE: The Good Stuff  : DThe best PVE content in my opinion is end-game. Like anything there are good and bad sides. Let's get one thing straight, I have done every raid a bunch of times on my own and in a guild, and they are all doable with Pugs (random people) aside from AoD (unless you are over-geared, but for review sake, let's assume you have gear from the tier below the raid you are doing). The bosses in the ten-man raids are all fun. They aren't too hard that you rage out and quit the game, but aren't too easy that you get bored and quit the game. There are two bosses though, that are extremely difficult to most people (Rat Master and Zoda). I did Rat Master with only pugged raids and killed it almost every time, but never the first try (Rat Master: two tries, four tries, nine tries.) in order to enter the Chaos Dungeon (newest raid dungeon). People say it is impossible and cry, and cry, and cry. Put simply, it takes chatting software, strategy, practice, and skill. Not every one is meant to make it to the furthest endgame content in any MMO, and those people, usually have trouble accepting it. For me, PVE is the best part of the game, and reason I have played so much.Interesting Content: There are a lot of unique aspects of the game that I hadn't seen in others. 1. Costumes: these are either "grind your face off" or P2W items, but overall it is an interesting and "fun" aspect of the game. The amount of power you get from costumes depends on how many Runes you put in it to give you bonus stats. You can also combine costumes with a chance to get "rare" costumes. I have only gotten one "rare" from thirty combines total over a span of months of game play, but lucky people in my guild have gotten "rare" costumes with only one fusion.  2. Cards: cards are only dropped from monsters and bosses. They give you bonus stats, and you can combine them to get rare cards, with great stat bonuses. 3. Phantom Pyramid: this is a P2W mini-game that you play in order to win content. It is based on RNG and can provide great rewards, or waste money (in-game or real life money) and time. Overall this is a great F2P *once you hit max level*. There are bugs, and the only real issue I have is the lack of attention put towards fixing those bugs faster. If you are a talented PVE player in any MMO game, be prepared to be surrounded by the most idiotic players you have ever seen (mainly Tier 1 raids and early game five man dungeons). You have to find people that are awesome players to raid with from the pugs you do, or join a great guild. There is a decent job system, and class system (with a nicely set up talent tree for each class). And even though I say to myself, "why would the developers do that?" more than I would like to, I ffind myself logging back in to play (way too often). PS: Thanks for reading my book.

number of helpful: 7 of 17 people (41%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 4, 2014
												This game isn't nearly as bad as people make it out to be and this coming from someone who played RO1 for years. If you don't expect the game to be something it's not (a AAA major mmo with an extensive raiding end game, RO1 in 3D etc) and just enjoy it a fun, casual game it's very enjoyable. The art style is pleasing, smooth with a beautiful color pallette and a very animated feel to it. The classes/stats have a build system that reminds me quite a lot of the original game and the story is even pretty decent, if the translation is very hit or miss. The highlights of RO2 are it's non-combat sytems like card collecting and pet building as well as crafting. I'm sure that someone who plays the game for 1000+ hours will find many things wrong but if you're looking for a light hearted escape with some old school mechanics it's well worth a few hours a week.

number of helpful: 7 of 17 people (41%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												As a note, this is my first time reviewing a game, so if it sucks.... Bite me ^^Ragnarok online 2 I picked up by accident, clicking it while trying to get rid of an ad, and then downloading it out of curiosity. I am quite pleased I did.The game itself is (from my limited experience), reminiscent of the playstyle of early WoW. Focused on the usual core classes and the first person MMO style I very much enjoy. The core classes are pretty varied, with option to diversify into two subsets when you get to a higher level. Atop the core classes there is a Job system which is while second to your class, has its own leveling system and, through proper use of the job system will allow you to level much quicker. Simply put, you can make your own armor and weapons, make your own potions, or buff yourself even as a fighter before a match, depending on the job you pick.The game is Free to play, so I would say it is at least worth a brief look at if nothing else. (As a note, the graphics start of fairly high end, nearly crippling my laptop on my first go. I would advise reducing the render distance to 2-3 to make sure it wont interfere with gameplay).I would say that the game greatly benefits from having friends to play with, but it can be a fairly enjoyable solo adventure, with a surprisingly interesting story. I expected a simplistic, insulting reason to just go and murder several areas of color swapped creatures. Instead I got a large variety of creatures, many different NPC's and points of view. While not perfect there has been honest effort to make an interesting and involved story in which you participate, including an earlier section whereupon you end up fighting your own repressed memories.I certainly would rate this worth a try, and possibly to keep.7.5/10

												Play it and decide whit your head don't trust all these negative reviews most of them admitted they didn't even play it more than 10 mins. It's a really nice game not too hard if you are alone but sure a lot better if you are in a party. Unfortunately it's still in the middle of development and every patch bring a bug and fix the previous one. On the other hand every patch bring a lot of new contents so the game has always something new to do also if you reached the cap lv. If you have patience to all the bugs that this game still has is a nice game (you can see how many hours i played until now). As EVERY free to play has buyable content that give you shortcuts to gain items and cute costumes to wear or mount to travel a bit more fast trought the world. The so hated vip pachage that increase your stats and your drop rate by 5 points it'a a nice thing but don't trust who say that makes this game a Pay to Win. It's a free game download it and try it you will see the items in the shop are not so powerfull, most of them are just costumes, or paints for your costumes. I repeat it's a free to play game but developers need to eat too so it's normal that there is a shop in game where you need to use real cash and where you will find helpfull things. You don't want bugs? You don't want and in game shop? go and play world of warcraft and pay 14 euros every month and don't try to jump a payment.PS yes there is a lag after the last patch but they recently improved the graphics and they still need to optimize it, they recently introduced a beta tester server and developers will be more focused on EU and USA servers soon AND even more these days is going on an event for new caracters created these weeks.

I couldn't even get to the options menu to make the game full screen to see if that would work, know why? cause the button for the options menu is at the bottom of the game screen & I can't get my mouse low enough to select it without clicking outside the window. & for that matter, what mmo defaults to windowed mode?! This is the only mmorpg that I've ever seen do that. Every other one I've played make windowed mode a secondary option in the options menu with fullscreen as the default.In summary, this thing is so broken I can't even create a character. That should speak volumes for this steaming pile.

number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 23, 2014
												A fantastic MMORPG. The graphics are stunning making you feel immersed in the game. Unqiue NPC's and carefully designed zones are everyone. This game hosts a wonderful community with a bit of the downside also though. Since this was originally a Korean MMO, the text has been translated yet it is very poor one at that which can lead to confusion for the player. Majority of the quests are the same as well us the usual of MMO's, re-using rigs. Ragnarok Online 2 is a point and click game which while seems annoying, it is also very useful too as the 3D graphics provides multiple mobs. One of my personal peeves of RO2 is the abundance of glitches, bugs, and others alike. I am able to experiance more then fifteen different ones a day (playing for maybe 10 hours or so). All in all, this is a wonderful game and absolutely my favorite.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												This game is P2W only if you care about PVP. Since I don't, I've enjoyed my time greatly just messing around in the world with the quests.Yes it does suck that costumes are random, but you can alleviate it a bit.People will pay good in-game coin for VIP passes, which can be purchased on the store for real money. Simply find people to sell those VIP passes, then go to the auction house (Yes there's an action house. It took me forever to realize that) and pick and choose which costumes you want. It may be a bit more expensive than trying your luck, but in the long run you can get exactly what you want for much cheaper than through the gambling system.

												I recemmend Ragonarok Online 2 for those that are looking to not be stuck in how the 'Predecessor' was.  Let's get a few things out the way, YES it can be grindy. ALL MMO's are, if you're playing one that doesn't make you work for it then you're just playing Trick or Treat. As a few review stated, It is a good starting MMO. But it isn't bad for veteran MMO players who wish to research and test different systems and even more so for those that don't mind hunting for to make themselves better in the end. The card system is still around with a better revamp in my opinion. And instead of the need to drop it in equipment you just attune it to yourself.

content:
Posted: May 16, 2013
												Having played this game now for a good length after American launch, I can say that things are SLOWLY improving.  Is it a worthy successor of the original RO?  Some ways: yes, others: no.  The graphic style translated very nicely over to 3D and the game definitely has the Original's feel.What is missing, however, is the level of accesorizing, number of jobs and even number of skills available to classes.  Accesorizing is still there, but limited and difficult to find good accesories that are not limited time items.  They over came some problems the original had and dropped new ones in your lap.My #1 gripe remains the 'support' given to the game.  Warp Portal, the service used as launcher and forums/tech support system is unfriendly to use and hard to locate what you need.  If you make an error filling out a form, they don't tell you what is wrong.  When you ask for password recovery, you're still waiting on the promised email hours later.  GMs are still aloof with no way to contact one.To thier credit, they did manage to fix the chat issues.Overall, I say play the game. If you like it, you'll love it.  But pray you never get technical difficulties!

content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												This game is great, before I thought it would be boring because it wasn't really like the original (the one I wanted to play) and when I tried it I was scared of lagging, but the last time I tried it and made my account for the last time I wasn't much of an MMoer and didn't know how to reduce lag, now I did, and I can play well. I like how you can be a vendor without sacrificing your ability to choose a class for fighting.It's also cool how you can get slots in your bag for free.This is a real F2P.PLAY IT. NOW!New Edit: I quit due to the fact I was tired of daily questing, since my important quests wouldn't show up after leveling soo much, New Edit #2: But now its fixing up. :O since I need an mmo to play I'm getting back to this and all other mmos ive been trying are utterless crap. This game is really smooth to play which is why I miss it, so if you haven't played World of Warcraft which lures you back in all the time, I reccomend this game.New Edit: its pretty fun and dungeons are good. Its balanced IMO and there arent so much skills but not so little. Im playing it again and probably not quitting for a while. My friend finally got to play it again on her new Windows 8. Now that was off-topic, its a pretty great game. I SAID IT SO MUCH.+Pros:Fun partying and guildingLots of timely rewards like EXP boosters, which make grinding easy.Profession Classes!+Cons:Gets boring sometimes when grindingHard to find parties in a timely manner.MORE to come

content:
Posted: January 5, 2014
												For this game, i would say it has a butt ton of tech problems and i have had nothing but problems with my bottons and more..But for a game that is free, all i can say is that this is, no it is one of  the best free mmo i have ever played!I have played a ton of online game coming all the way down the free, cheap, to tottaly out of the mind expensive. Yes, the voices in the game lack quality, the card books have a time limmit... butThis is the first game i have played, that i haven't been rudely harrased for being a new player. I have played Final Fantasy 14 ARR since it first came out, i was a betta tester. My fiance began playing it latter to find the both of us being called rude, and tasteless names anyways we had taken our time to help others, craft, perk and dp with others. We still have to say it has, and is one of the most horrible expeinces iv ever had playing a game.. Nothing worse then eliete players with their swords suved so far up their... you know whats.. in a game that you had been playing the game since it was first launched...and be called a "noob:. or even worce... I was called a d i c k s u c k e r in a dp for i told someone to wait for our tank.... Even in Guildwars 2, Eve online, Star craft 2, Star Trek i had the same issues... no one to help me figgure crafting, perks, or armour... nothing but stuck up and dishounorable people.This game has problems, but not in a way that makes you want to stop playing, but are hard to play around.For example, i have, and i mean HAVE to reset my bottons for crafting and armour everytime i click on them to use them.Another, in areas of the first lower level zones i get attacked by non existing enimies..That is a problem....Cards can be a problem, you have a time limmit when it comes up to your card album in whitch i find really anoiying.Infact, most of the stuff you do get has aa time limmit, it is at times a pay too win but it is free if you don't let it bother you too much.I have a good computer... iv had one one issue with a lag spike but that is erelevent... Their are progreming flaws, but i am sure they are working on it as we speak.. The main problems with some enviroments is the suroundings sometimes randomly building as you get closer to them, and i dont mean slightly i mean.. right infront of you sometimes it will sprout a christmas tree 0_0 or a building...The voices for the npc's are horrible... and some fit, that is due to budget.. and lazyness... can't complain too muchI would just take them out if it was my game and just make people read more, but its not my game .. XDThe music is.... AMAZING!  Some areas have music that is a tad anoiying but it fits the enviroments... Im not sure who made the music but i bow down to your greatness! The selects for your new creations if you want to start a new game are limmited, but aren't bad..Eyes, Eye color, hairstyles and faces, colors, voices.. are pretty good!The side jobs  are very limmited, Chef, Cook, Alch, and Light arm, Heavyarm. Pretty good. And the main jobs are also incredibly limmited, Swordsman, Arch, Healer, Mage, and Theif... They do have Another pick besides Humans, but only one other... can't complain too much.Generic is the name for it...The animations are okay, the idol animations make you look like for in a fastion show.. pretty stuid But, all and all.Not bad at all for a game that is FREE! XD

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Ok let me tell you what I think about the new Ragnarok 2. I am also a original Ragnarok series fan and let me tell you Ragnarok 2 is no where near the originial Ragnarok But there are the good things and the bad things. So heres my break down.So far ive reached lv 25/25 combat and job proffession so im pretty much halfway the game.1. Crafting System - 9/10The crafting system is simply great. At the beginning of the game you choose your specific proffesion. for example blacksmiths gather materials from minable rocks around the whole map while artisans carve out leathers from your hunted enemies. this system is really engaging and makes grinding more fun!2. Gameplay/Mechanics - 7/10Rather than the old skill point and click Ragnarok 2 lean more towards on modern MMORPG 3rd person view press "tab" to change target. I def. prefer the original series game mechanics. But im not gonna lie there is something interesting with the new system. The new skill mechanic has a combo counter and you use this counter to use stronger skills. A good combo strategic style of gameplay3. Raiding - 8.5/10Extremely difficult almost impossible to solo unless you are 20 levels over the dungeon. nonethless its how you play the game. with parties and cooperative. Raiding in ragnarok 2 is as fun as the original series. no difference from other mmorpg usually played in roles. tank etc etcoverall verdict, ill give it 2 thumbs up and would let everyone to try! its fun and its new forget the old era its suppose to be innovated.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
												Had a tough time with the confusing "sign up for an account" through Steam, but I had previously signed up for an account through WarpPortal. Each time you launch RO2 from Steam's library, you're forced to "sign up for an account" instead of leading you to a "sign in" page for the game or any kind of UI. This problem has been the same since day of release on Steam.It would be nice to see this problem fixed instead of manually nagivating to my Steam folder > Steamapps > Common > Ragnarok Online 2 folder to delete WPLauncher.exe or rename to WPLauncher2 then rename RagnarokOnline2.exe to WPLauncher.exeScore: 6/10

number of helpful: 6 of 17 people (35%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												Yes and no.  If you like anime and mmo's then this, by far, has the best anime based graphics available in an mmo.  Personally, I think the content needs to be darker.  It is all well and good to have your happy forest full of goofy creatures, but you need to have your dark forest (or cave, that'd be cool for a zone...) full of zombies and necromancers too.  If it is in the game, then they need to introduce it earlier in the game. (of course it is too late now...). This game is good about the whole 'buy power' thing.  Only thing I've noticed is the VIP pass that provides a stat bonus and earns more currency in dungeons (which i assume is used to purchase stronger end-game gear).  All-in-all, it is a balanced game with a classic mmo playstyle and a unique crafting system.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												Definitely a well done MMO, probably the only one I've ever played at length. Best played with a group of people, which is pretty normal, but solo-ing at least up until the first dungeon is viable. You can party with random players at anytime, and as long as you have a good healer, dungeons are possible. Just the right difficulty level to keep you interested with a minimal amount of roaming. First mount comes earlier than you'd expect, and is really nice for traversing the map so you dont get bored early on when you're just farming anyway.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												I guess you can call it "Standard-MMO".It has a bit of the old RO flair through design elements, classes and mobs but all in all hasnt much to do with its predecessor.It got tweaked a bit for european and american standards so that you do not have to grind your♥♥♥♥♥off like the "classic" RO. I have to agree to the most people that it can get very boring very fast if you do not have a knack for the RO-Universe and its cuddly graphics.The most negative parts about the game are the fact that it is Pay 2 Win the moment you gain max. level, no way around it, I have to name it. I myself wasted around 100€ (yeah I am that stupid) with useless lottery systems and the try to get more money to use.Second thing is that there are still a ton of bugs, it seems like it was programmed with no love at all, the most serious bugs got fixed (Dungeonfinder and some graphic-elements) but there is still a long way to go.All in all I recommend this game for every fan of Ragnarok Online to try it out at least.Leveling is relatively quick and you do not really have to spend any money until you reach higher levels.

content:
Posted: February 27, 2014
												Return to the beautiful and dangerous world of Midgard! Inspired by Norse mythology, the much-anticipated sequel to the groundbreaking Ragnarok Online has arrived! Immerse yourself in the new, but recognizable world of Ragnarok 2. Visit the large, capitol city of Prontera, form a party and explore the underwater Sea Temple dungeon, or set up a shop and earn a living for your character by accepting a job as an Alchemist, Artisan, Blacksmith, or Chef. Adventurers who have explored the world of RO1 will instantly recognize many of the famous monsters and landmarks as their journeys continue. The fun social experiences of character customization, guild creation and PVP play have also returned! Ragnarok 2 is a free-to-play, fantasy MMORPG that takes elements from the original Ragnarok Online and re-imagines them as a three-dimensional, modern MMO experience.

												 I had some fun with this game 2 years ago, even though I'm not sure what's it like now but judging by the reviews, not so good.    I had several maxed level characters and I hated that the best gears in the game can be obtained by just participating in PvP. The worst part is that there's only certain time of the day you can do pvp.... something like 1am, 1pm, 6pm each last one hour long.    But what's the point of crafting, and other dungeons, if everyone can just do pvp instead? What about the people that has a job or a normal life? How can they participate pvp at these time? (I actually did get those pvp set gears for all my characters, but I felt like I was forced to do something to get something else in return. )    Unless you have all day to sit there and go to pvp at certain times  it will take you forever to get Colo gears and proceed to harder dungeons....

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 15, 2015
												When I was transitioning between games until FFXIV came out, I played a lot of this. Even now when I play FFXIV, there's times I actually missed playing this game. I played it on the release day up until shortly before Noel came out, and there were a ton of bugs after release. But the bugs were mostly funny to me, and as someone who has played a lot of both Free to Play and subscription MMOs, it's extremely understandable for a game to have a slew of bugs after release or post-patch. What matters is how they were handled.The bosses were fun, the Emnity list for tanking was actually EXTREMELY useful (something I've always missed is the ability to see the parties' exact emnity values as I'm tanking), the game is colourful and pretty, mobs range from adorable to awesome in appearance, and above all, the game is maintained on micro transactions that -are not required pay to wins-. Although you can buy items that'll enhnce your abilities for a certain time and progress quicker through the game, you dont -have- to in order to keep going.People seem to forget how great this is when you play something Free to Play. Tons of micro transaction games will have you "Pay-to-Win" in order to become anything of value beyond the beginning levels and some players would literally pour thousands of dollars per week into specials just to gain and if you didn't have that kind of money, you'd have to spend days grinding or competing with bots in order to earn enough of the in-game currency to trade with someone for it in order to just do the real content. Despite the exorbitant amounts of money some communities would dump into these games, they would -still- be rife with game breaking bugs. So what is everyone's complaint with RO2 when compared to the majority of F2P MMOs?This game is fun, is enhanced by but not dominated by it's cash shop, and is a good casual thing to play without requiring a huge time sink. Yes, it has bots, bugs, and elitists, but what MMO doesn't?

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
												Hi everyone,after playing Ragnarok Online, i decided that I would try out the successor, warts and all. Well it certainly has some quirks to it. I dont mean that in a negative way. Dungeons are pretty much "please party me" and a Master Level comes and does the dungeon for you. As far as game mechanics go, if you've played mmos this is a pretty easy one to learn. the only criticism is that I dont see many parties, or indeed difficult dungeons that need roles in them. The only experience of partying i had was in sograt desert, where tanks would round up all mobs and everyone else would dps them to death.I can't say that It grabbed me, mostly because all players I have touched base with have also finished playing. I started maybe december last year, and quit after a few months, and started again, only to find none of my friends were still playing. As far as challenge goes, i have yet to face anything challenging in this game (due to multitude of ML players) who are willing to go through dungeons. The real game starts once you have mastered your class. This poses an interesting dilemma though. As most people do not play this regularly (maybe once a week) you are left to yourself largely to do the gameThis is my experience playing RO2.There are a large amount of guilds to play for WOE which gets its name from the battlefield challenge for guilds in the original game. Also public chat has a bunch of players that you can talk to.

content:
Posted: September 13, 2015
												Although it strives very much to live up to expectations, it seems like it cannot be done. At least not in full blown frontal 3D.*If* you want to play something that will remind you of the original Ragnarok Online, then you will be probably heavily disappointed. The only thing that binds them together are a parts of the lore (still, very fuzzy).*If* you are looking for yet another 3D MMO, then this is probably the right spot.- Graphics are meh. Not in terms of the quality, but in terms of the visual style. I would expect something more from Gravity. Something that would fit into the sprite style of the original, but in a refreshed enviroment. Pastel Colors & outline more? Hard to tell, but for sure this one looks just bleak and boring.- Controls. Could have been way worse. They mostly kept the RO style so quick bars, and shift-ctrl bindings, which are just perfect.  The camera seems a little sluggish though.- Mechanics. Ruined it all. Boatloads of stuff, which at the first glance, have no coherent meaning and connection to the way the game play. Given for example the *new and confusing* card system. Took me a while to figure out. Also, the forging system looks a lil bit grindish' (but hey, that's ragnarok after all).- Micro-payement. Reason for which i dropped the game. Don't get me wrong. I would like to pay, it it's done in a sensible manner. Here it is NOT. You have very slight idea of what you're paying for, what you will get, and what YOU ACTUALLY NEED. There are tons of stuff, most of them undescribed. Sure, you can buy *something*, but you need to do some digging to get the info on what it is, can you actually use, or how long will it last.The whole game, minus the messed up micro payments is bearable.Sooo... with the payments, it's not. That a NO from me.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												I've played through about half of this MMO, but I'll keep this short an sweet. They give you a few sweet little items now and then to encourage you to play, force you through group dungeons for the main story (horrible for a solo player like myself), and then after a certain point you realize those items you'd gotten earlier are cash market stuff and the in-game and quest rewards are crap so it becomes Pay-To-Win very swiftly. When the original RO was subscription based, I'd played a trial of that and wanted to continue playing it but couldn't pay the subscription fee. I gave RO2 a chance, but then it just became a steaming pile.Game play isn't bad, the story is pretty lame, class system could be a lot better, controls are basic, graphics are. . . fine for what it is. Fans of the original RO, don't play this, I was sorely disappointed after a few hours of play, but pushed forward until I just gave up on it.

content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												I loved Ragnarok from the beginning. I game I didn't need to save! WOW! (It was my first online mmorpg) So I've used to play every day from the beta for maybe three years almost every day.When I knew this game was about to be released I was really happy, because it was a new version of a game so important to me that led me to love playing online games in general.Watched videos and waited a long time so I could finally get it in my steam and remember all the things I loved about Ragnarok.This game has everything I liked about the older one like classes, monsters, cards and cliches, and many new things that I consider improvements that made me spend a few hours on it.So why am I giving it a bad review? It's a P2W game. If you don't pay, you can't enjoy the game at all. It's free only for tryouts. If you do not intend to spend money here, you won't have a good time at all. Don't get me wrong, I liked the game, but lying to me saying it's free to play is not good. I pay for other games monthly and wouldn't mind maybe spending here from time to time, but compete with others who got more money, that's just something I won't do. If you don't have a big problem with this such as I, go ahead and give it a shot.

content:
Posted: May 12, 2013
												Ragnarok Online 2 is a very generalized and normalized MMO. There is nothing that is groundbreaking that you will see in the game. However, it doesn't suffer from the normal overseas issues that most F2P MMOs have. You are not forced to put money in the game to make sure you can level quickly and effectively. The quests don't run out as you level. And, it keeps it's pace very well. If you want a free MMO that helps you get a feel of a solid online story, try Ragnarok Online 2. If you want something hardcore, keep waiting for Wildstar.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
												Ragnarok Online 2, the supposed to be Ragnarok Online successor which was different from the Gates of the World.I really tried to love the game but it really fell short. I came back to the game after being inactive and sadly, I still can't love the game.If you are looking for a nostalgic RO experience, give it a try.The Good:- Like I've said, it gives a soft RO nostalgia.- It's fun to play with friends especially dungeons.The bad:- Gameplay: It is so slow paced in battle. During raids and boss hunts, as a support I would usually just spam a skill then that's just it. I just watched the healthbars slowly diminished then that's it. - Graphics: Graphics isn't top notched. I placed this second since I prioritize gameplay over graphics. - The Aftergame: You have two options after you maxed out, boss hunts and world boss hunts (i.e Goblin Leader) for Equipment drops or maybe PVP? Either of the two, you would be easily get bored especially if you can secure good equips earlier than expected. There's nothing much to do when you reach the level cap.-- There's too much game related factor that pulls the game down, but who knows it's still updating despite RO2 being discontinued in Korea. But IMO, I would likely play Dragon Nest or Tera than RO2.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 28, 2015
												I've been playing Ragnarok for only 3 days so far, but I can already tell this is a pretty well made game. The combat system is really good (And that's a huge part of it for me), the variety in each class's strengths is great, and it's a great game to play online with your friends and follow the story quests together. I definitely recommend getting Ragnarok if you're looking for a good in-depth anime MMORPG to play with your friends.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
												Hi everyone,after playing Ragnarok Online, i decided that I would try out the successor, warts and all. Well it certainly has some quirks to it. I dont mean that in a negative way. Dungeons are pretty much "please party me" and a Master Level comes and does the dungeon for you. As far as game mechanics go, if you've played mmos this is a pretty easy one to learn. the only criticism is that I dont see many parties, or indeed difficult dungeons that need roles in them. The only experience of partying i had was in sograt desert, where tanks would round up all mobs and everyone else would dps them to death.I can't say that It grabbed me, mostly because all players I have touched base with have also finished playing. I started maybe december last year, and quit after a few months, and started again, only to find none of my friends were still playing. As far as challenge goes, i have yet to face anything challenging in this game (due to multitude of ML players) who are willing to go through dungeons. The real game starts once you have mastered your class. This poses an interesting dilemma though. As most people do not play this regularly (maybe once a week) you are left to yourself largely to do the gameThis is my experience playing RO2.There are a large amount of guilds to play for WOE which gets its name from the battlefield challenge for guilds in the original game. Also public chat has a bunch of players that you can talk to.

												Ragnarok II is an entertaining game that can be enjoyed on your own or with a group of friends. Of course, in most games online having a group of friends almost always makes a game more enjoyable. In this one though you will most likely be able to fully like it on it's own merits if you wanted to solo through most of the game yourself. The game has quite a few features and is at least as great as any other MMORPG that is out there. No matter what you want out of this game, you will get at least a few quality hours of gameplay from it for sure.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												I loved Ragnarok from the beginning. I game I didn't need to save! WOW! (It was my first online mmorpg) So I've used to play every day from the beta for maybe three years almost every day.When I knew this game was about to be released I was really happy, because it was a new version of a game so important to me that led me to love playing online games in general.Watched videos and waited a long time so I could finally get it in my steam and remember all the things I loved about Ragnarok.This game has everything I liked about the older one like classes, monsters, cards and cliches, and many new things that I consider improvements that made me spend a few hours on it.So why am I giving it a bad review? It's a P2W game. If you don't pay, you can't enjoy the game at all. It's free only for tryouts. If you do not intend to spend money here, you won't have a good time at all. Don't get me wrong, I liked the game, but lying to me saying it's free to play is not good. I pay for other games monthly and wouldn't mind maybe spending here from time to time, but compete with others who got more money, that's just something I won't do. If you don't have a big problem with this such as I, go ahead and give it a shot.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												One of the most exciting things in RO1 was cards and RO2 is huge disapointment in cards system. Most cards just give +x to str/dex/etc, and its not fun at all, when you have 300+ str and find a card that gives +8 str, yay.... no... There are some interesting cards but they are rare from high level bosses.Also stats on lvl up doesn't seem very impactfull because later on you start getting gears with a lot more stats than you get in all 50 lvls.I don't have much play time but other than cards system i really enjoy this game. Leveling is easy and reaching lvl50 solo is fast and only then the real game starts. When you quest for master level 1 and equip new master gears you feel so OP compared to what you were at lvl50. But once you enter master lvl zones.. ouch :DQuesting always gives nice EXP and is faster lvling that way than just grinding. Something about questing that just keeps me doing quest then the next one and the next one. Overall it is fun game and as big Ro1 fan i can say that they did good job remaking Ro2.Oh, if you loved monk in Ro1, you will hate it in Ro2. Monks here are tanks as a heard.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 5, 2013
												After 3h into the game I still feel like in the tutorial zone, with the same quests over and over again (kill x monsters of type y; get x items from monster type y etc.). Everybody looks the same (because the best gear right now is the one from the quests). It does a rather poor job of explaining itself. Especially in an MMORPG you want players to understand all the features, not just some information about every feature. If you like RO 1 or WoW, I guess you're gonna like this as well. If you don't (like me), keep your hands off this time sink. After 3h I still feel like I have achieved a whole bunch of nothing.Aside from stuttering in the crowded areas and lags everywhere, there is nothing to complain regarding the technical standpoint of the game. I don't get why such low poly models and low res textures cause it to stutter so much.The graphic style is lovely, and the jump to 2D really helps the experience. But while being lovely, it's nothing extraordinary.I appreciate what they did with RO, but unfortunately it's still not for me.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 22, 2015
												I've played Ragnarok Online 2 for over two hundred hours.That probably says something about my lack of a social life more than the game, but whatever.It's not a terrible game. I won't say it's the worst one out there. I enjoyed it - to a point. Overall, I'd give it a passing grade of 6/10, but if there was a 50/50 recommend option I'd definitely select it.The pros:Free. That's the biggy. You can easily play it and wipe it off your hardrive without regrets if necessary.Had a great time as an assassin. DPS is the way to go; tank and healer classes have much less fun in RO2.Lots of class diversity, something inherited from RO1.Lots of dungeons if you actually have friends or manage to join a guild.The cons:Hah! Like you can join a guild! Hardly anyone plays, so you end up waiting for randoms half the time or, if you're not masochistic, skipping the dungeons altogether. Without dungeons there are massive holes in both the plot and your equipment list.Class diversity is cool to a point. RO2 isn't forgiving when it comes to min/maxing mistakes; you often have to buy reset scrolls. This leads to cookie cutter characters and people afraid to go off the path.The grind is real! Good god I had a terrible time of it, and I was DPS! For example, a quest in Izlude. This was to kill 25 mermen soldiers, then 25 mermen warriors. Immediately afterwards, you get a quest to kill 25 slightly different mermen soldiers and 25 slightly different mermen warriors. After that, you get an optional quest to kill fifty more mermen, except these are merwoman! My loathing for this scenario led me to come back with a fire magician. I nuked the whole fishy place. If you don't do it with friends, you're stuck slowly killing entire hordes alone. Hopefully you brought potions, or every three enemies you'll be stopping to eat.Premium items. Premium mounts. Ugh. I see people walk by with their five dollar peco peco and I want to facepalm. The walking is worse than the grinding. At least with the grinding we can watch the flashy animations. The mounts help slightly, but the flying outposts are few and far between, plus they aren't marked very well. As an assassin, I could actually outrace most normal mounts by quaffing a speed potion, which was sad. To go any faster? Buy premium mounts.Interface is odd. Auction house is the most egregious example. You can't even use the search bar, leaving you to slowly search through pages upon pages of items before you find something you want.All in all, I feel like I have to recommend trying it, just because I have the founder's title and I spent so long playing. It was entertaining for a while, but ultimately I set it down when I reached the end. Not much replayability once you get to max level - you'll never want to go through certain sections again, which makes making a new character a serious pain.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 2
												Ragnarok online (RO) 1 is way better than this. RO 2 lacks of a chanllenge, is buggy and very repetitive.Although they are more organized (now there is a detailed quest menu), the quests are pretty much the same, none of then are hard or interesting, very diferent from quest of RO 1 (in RO 1 the quests to change class are dificult and interesting, each class has its own change quest. RO 2 doesn't have those quests, you start directly with a chose class).The cards aren't anymore unique, all the cards I got do the same thing: give some random stats. In RO 1, each monster card has unique effects.There aren't any deadly monster in the game, even the bosses are easy to kill ( one of the first bosses you fight has the apearence of the boss Kiel from RO 1, a hard to find and hard to kill in RO 1, but in RO 2 you don't need a single potion to kill it alone). Another issue about monsters: you receive an option to automatcaly enter in dungeons and fight against a boss that will aways be in the end of dungeon, wainting for the player, you don't need to find out the dungeons entrance or compete with others party players to find the boss anymore. The worst thing about this automatic dungeon sistem is that you can enter in a top level dungeon with no worries, the game gives you a temporary top overpowered level character to finish that dungeon.The game is almost empty (this is kind of consequence of a bad MMO) and the buildings of the city (Prontera) are TOO big. You feel like an ant. The big size makes sense to a castle, a statue or a defending wall, but even to a common house? A door whith a 4 meters high to characters and NPCs that doesn't seen to have 1,80m high? Really?RO 1 has many flaws, that were amplified with the release of the 3rd classes, but it is much better than it's successor.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Ragnarok Online 2 is a new and futuristic game of Ragnarok Online which was 2D and simple. I love the game. Something I hate with a passion really are games and developers who only have a color pallet of brown and grey. I want to see color, see vibrance and Ragnarok Online 2 delivers. The zones are all very different from deserts to canyons, to beaches to forests. I love it!Now don't get your hopes up. While I may love the zones in the game, I do not love the game. It's not eye catching or attaching. Unless you listen to the opening credits for your first spawn as a Noel, that's shockingly depressing. Nonetheless, it's just plane feeling and there's a lot of issues that just can't be over looked.For example:Rendering and LoS (Line of Sight), something you'll notice is max or not with field of view distance it's exactly the same. Not just that but it's about 30 meters around your character, so anything outside 30m is invisible on your screen. People still have issues with graphic lag. Yikes... I'm not one of them, but frankly I don't care to turn five degrees to my left and turn back only to have everything go invisible and untargetable because it decided "Oh, time to rerender into the game!"Invisible walls, Warriors are the equivalent of Billy Goats. Litteraly ignore these walls and jump on or over them. While kick♥♥♥♥♥to get ontop of areas you just normally never could, yeah it is a glitch and some serious exploiting. Not in PvP though, they cut your legs off in there."Event EXP" days are lies. I got to the higher tiers of levels and once you're there your experience changes to something called "Mastery Points" not very long to get, but look. With no buffs at all for Exp/MP gain... I get 1 point a kill on a x2 and x3 day, same even when the days are gone. With all Exp/MP gain buffs, that jumps to 5 - 10 points a kill depending on the area. Oh and mind you, these are all buffs you buy and apply. These do not include the lying x2/x3 days.Pay-To-Win, now it's expected these days when it comes to the term Free-to-Play. It's depressing, but true. Figures mean more then player happiness. The current level cap (12/31/2014) is 81, Mastery level 30. 1-50 then ML 1-30. You can buy 1-50 for $27.00 USD. While you're not getting ML 30, you're still skipping 50 levels for under 30 bucks. You do not want to see the rest of the market.Voice Acting, if she doesn't sound like a grandmother with a stoma she sounds like a pornstar sultry teacher. The males...Either Californian Stoned Surfer or Gayer than Liberace and Andy D***. You don't have other choices, this also includes your own characters voice. Mind you  these characters are supposed to be under the age of 18.Roleplay....You're now a pedophile, yes we've added your name to the list.End game content, now while I haven't essentially gotten here. I know shocking with my play time right? I have the following: ML 7 Assassin, ML 12 Priest, ML 7 Warrior, ML 1 Ranger, Lv 17 Soulmaster along with a lv 6/20 Guild that is mine. End game content is extremely non-existent in the sense you have some raids and a new battleground, but that doesn't happen till ML 14+. Ml 1 - 14 is litterally go find a group, and grind mobs. Do you remember how much I told mobs give in MP? Your exp to ML 2 is about 4000. Guess what ML 13 is. I dare you. Half of my game time is grinding these mobs. Go do quests right? I'm sorry what quests sir, yes there are litteraly no quests from ML 1 - 30.Player Base, I'm American. I speak English and Russian, and a bit of Japanese... I do not know the Filipino language. This game is owned by them, I struggle severely with a language barrier. Worse is the timezones, even harder is the fact once the pinoy population is gone...So is the player base. It may as well be dead, group finding and dungeon going is virtually impossible and people will fight just to join. There's no population diversity, and in the worst business decision in human history of games is there's two servers. Exactly the same as eachother, as the above states.Tade Chat, dear god...The prices are ridiculous and unreasonable, but once you see that everything you can craft needs purchase materials either via MP or NPC buys you'll understand. Even so I don't think any blue item is worth 20,000 anything. It's common for it to be 25,000+ for level 20 greens, not even ML ones. My tip, figure out how to get costumes and sell them. Those go for 80,000+.The game is fun, but not enjoyable. Fun to play because it's entertaining and simple, not enjoyable because of the pay-to-win market and even worse the player community base and ability of trade and commerce.Would I recommend this game? Not unless you like cartoonish games, even than I'd say, "Go try Fiesta Online."Will I continue to play? I can't stand grinding anymore..Over 10 hours to get just 2 levels, just no.Is it a bad game? Not at all, just not fun trying to get even near end game content, or really even worth it.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
												Ragnarok Online 2, the supposed to be Ragnarok Online successor which was different from the Gates of the World.I really tried to love the game but it really fell short. I came back to the game after being inactive and sadly, I still can't love the game.If you are looking for a nostalgic RO experience, give it a try.The Good:- Like I've said, it gives a soft RO nostalgia.- It's fun to play with friends especially dungeons.The bad:- Gameplay: It is so slow paced in battle. During raids and boss hunts, as a support I would usually just spam a skill then that's just it. I just watched the healthbars slowly diminished then that's it. - Graphics: Graphics isn't top notched. I placed this second since I prioritize gameplay over graphics. - The Aftergame: You have two options after you maxed out, boss hunts and world boss hunts (i.e Goblin Leader) for Equipment drops or maybe PVP? Either of the two, you would be easily get bored especially if you can secure good equips earlier than expected. There's nothing much to do when you reach the level cap.-- There's too much game related factor that pulls the game down, but who knows it's still updating despite RO2 being discontinued in Korea. But IMO, I would likely play Dragon Nest or Tera than RO2.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 27, 2013
												This game is hardly a worthy sequel to the original Ragnarok Online. RO2 has adopted a generic WoW-style interface and play style that aren't made up for by other features. Customization is limited to pasty beanpole types. The combat and questlines are bland and uninventive. The auction house and party finding systems are poorly designed. The music is nothing special, but there's a player-made patch to replace it with bgms from other Ragnarok titles. The good is that the monsters are the same cute critters from RO that we know and love, and there are plenty of classes to choose from. This game isn't awful, but it needs a lot of work before it can be called a quality MMO.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 4, 2013
												Ragnarok 2 (or RO2) is very interesting, animeish MMO that combines Asian style graphic and gameplay with Nordic mythology. With WoW, Rift or/and Allods way of combating and good choice of classes and skills, this game is extremely fun and has interesting way of leveling your character. Other than standard quest's you can do "achievement quest's" know as Khara quest's that also give you experience, money or even titles that give stats when equipped. Also you can collect cards that drop from specific mobs and equip them to your character for even more stats bonus.Other than few bugs that occur ingame like constant error message that say you're in combat but you aren't, mobs that psychically hit you from 15 yard's distance, etc, I would recommend this game for players that aren't that interested in end-game and just want MMO that will be fun while leveling your character.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 2, 2013
												I played this game a bit before it came to Steam while it was still in beta (I think).I have spent countless hours in the original Ragnarok Online. I first started playing it many years ago and I absolutely fell in love with it, and it was my very first MMORPG experience. Since I stopped playing that time, I've kept coming back to it several times, and every time I get swallowed up by it. It's still the very best in the genre that I have ever played, and I've played quite a few.When a sequel was first announced, I, like other fans, was really excited. Eventually they showed a very different game and the general opinion on it was luke warm. Gravity Interactive decided to scratch the whole thing. Later, this new sequel appeared. They have stated that they wanted to go back to the world of the original game. Finally, the game has reached the international player base. It is many years overdue.So, how does it hold up? To be blunt; the game is a bland, average MMORPG. Some elements have been kept, but all in all completely changed. There's a new card system unlike anything I've seen in any other game, but that's pretty much it. The rest is nothing special, and not a lot of fun. I think they completely blew it. It's very little impressive.If you are looking for a great MMORPG experience, this is probably not it. I suggest you try the original instead. It's free to try though.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												One of the most exciting things in RO1 was cards and RO2 is huge disapointment in cards system. Most cards just give +x to str/dex/etc, and its not fun at all, when you have 300+ str and find a card that gives +8 str, yay.... no... There are some interesting cards but they are rare from high level bosses.Also stats on lvl up doesn't seem very impactfull because later on you start getting gears with a lot more stats than you get in all 50 lvls.I don't have much play time but other than cards system i really enjoy this game. Leveling is easy and reaching lvl50 solo is fast and only then the real game starts. When you quest for master level 1 and equip new master gears you feel so OP compared to what you were at lvl50. But once you enter master lvl zones.. ouch :DQuesting always gives nice EXP and is faster lvling that way than just grinding. Something about questing that just keeps me doing quest then the next one and the next one. Overall it is fun game and as big Ro1 fan i can say that they did good job remaking Ro2.Oh, if you loved monk in Ro1, you will hate it in Ro2. Monks here are tanks as a heard.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 5, 2013
												After 3h into the game I still feel like in the tutorial zone, with the same quests over and over again (kill x monsters of type y; get x items from monster type y etc.). Everybody looks the same (because the best gear right now is the one from the quests). It does a rather poor job of explaining itself. Especially in an MMORPG you want players to understand all the features, not just some information about every feature. If you like RO 1 or WoW, I guess you're gonna like this as well. If you don't (like me), keep your hands off this time sink. After 3h I still feel like I have achieved a whole bunch of nothing.Aside from stuttering in the crowded areas and lags everywhere, there is nothing to complain regarding the technical standpoint of the game. I don't get why such low poly models and low res textures cause it to stutter so much.The graphic style is lovely, and the jump to 2D really helps the experience. But while being lovely, it's nothing extraordinary.I appreciate what they did with RO, but unfortunately it's still not for me.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 12, 2014
												For old-ragnarok players, it is a whole new game from what you know of ragnarok 1. The first thing you would notice is that  the combat system is totally new as compared the older ragnarok game. The new combat system is now similar to most of the MMORPG games wherein you press buttons to cast skills and to attack. Also, you will notice that you can no longer rely on pure attack speed alone. Unlike in the previous ragnarok, where archers and assasins have builds that has a very fast ASPD, this new game heavily relies on your skills. Another thing you would notice would be the mobs. There are new mobs in here but some mobs from the previous game is still in play. Also, the new game employs a dungeon system that is not in the previous game. So basically, you will feel that you are playing a VERY different game from the ragnarok you already know.For those who didn't played the old ragnarok, this is an game with excellent graphics as well as sound. They have quests that help the new players in understanding the gameplay. But it isn't too boring as to render old MMORPG players dozing off while playing the initial, or introductory, stages of the game. They also provide various items for new players such as free mounts, costumes, potions, etc. So overall, its a game that can compete as the best MMORPG

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 2
												Ragnarok online (RO) 1 is way better than this. RO 2 lacks of a chanllenge, is buggy and very repetitive.Although they are more organized (now there is a detailed quest menu), the quests are pretty much the same, none of then are hard or interesting, very diferent from quest of RO 1 (in RO 1 the quests to change class are dificult and interesting, each class has its own change quest. RO 2 doesn't have those quests, you start directly with a chose class).The cards aren't anymore unique, all the cards I got do the same thing: give some random stats. In RO 1, each monster card has unique effects.There aren't any deadly monster in the game, even the bosses are easy to kill ( one of the first bosses you fight has the apearence of the boss Kiel from RO 1, a hard to find and hard to kill in RO 1, but in RO 2 you don't need a single potion to kill it alone). Another issue about monsters: you receive an option to automatcaly enter in dungeons and fight against a boss that will aways be in the end of dungeon, wainting for the player, you don't need to find out the dungeons entrance or compete with others party players to find the boss anymore. The worst thing about this automatic dungeon sistem is that you can enter in a top level dungeon with no worries, the game gives you a temporary top overpowered level character to finish that dungeon.The game is almost empty (this is kind of consequence of a bad MMO) and the buildings of the city (Prontera) are TOO big. You feel like an ant. The big size makes sense to a castle, a statue or a defending wall, but even to a common house? A door whith a 4 meters high to characters and NPCs that doesn't seen to have 1,80m high? Really?RO 1 has many flaws, that were amplified with the release of the 3rd classes, but it is much better than it's successor.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												All the bugs are so common they have own names and each player knows how to deal with them. They are annoying. Leveling from 1-50 is the only adventure you'll ever see, from that on ML1 foward it's grind grind grind, and dealing with players who bought refining stuff to be 40 times better than you'll ever be (unless you want to pay money for them too). The Elements used in Condors, Mukas and Osi dungeon become pointless after Osi. DPS classes like rangers have really low damage unless they can somehow afford costumes with runes. Nowdays you can't even buy rune drills without real money. It's really sad, I loved this game much but it's too annoying.
